column1: 954D5438-DD74-4B29-8BB8-3E9A104563FA#appfire#2B39C414-1366-45D7-9115-D2FAAE2181A7#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 14:23:08.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 14:23:08.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#95F79B88-C7F2-4B05-860C-23669BDC96C6#appfire#2B39C414-1366-45D7-9115-D2FAAE2181A7#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 14:23:08.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 14:23:08.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#F788CF22-A20C-4F0E-BB74-81CBCC70B74E#appfire#2B39C414-1366-45D7-9115-D2FAAE2181A7#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 14:23:08.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 14:23:08.0#appfire#1
